actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Foreign Affairs.

official_title: A bill to amend the Export Administration Act of 1969 to require the imposition of controls on the exportation of wheat and wheat flour, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Amends the Export Administration Act of 1969 to direct the Secretary of Commerce to require a validated license for the export of wheat and wheat flour. Provides for the export license fees in the case of countries imposing restrictions on goods to the detriment of the United States, with specified exceptions. Expresses the sense of the Congress that export controls on U.S. goods and technology should be imposed with respect to countries engaging in inequitable trade practices towards the United States.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Export Administration Act of 1969 to require the imposition of controls on the exportation of wheat and wheat flour, and for other purposes.
